channel.title: math.RT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.RT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Dirac cohomology of minimal representations
item.description: arXiv:2404.17408v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper, we study the Dirac cohomology of minimal representations for all real reductive groups G. The Dirac indices of these representations are also studied when G is of equal rank, giving some counterexamples of a conjecture of Huang proposed in 2015.
item.dc:creator: Xuanchen Zhao

item.title: Partial representations of connected and smash product Hopf algebras
item.description: arXiv:2404.17303v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We show that every partial representation of a connected Hopf algebra is global. Some interesting classes of partial representations of smash product Hopf algebras are studied, and a description of the partial "Hopf" algebra if the first tensorand is connected is given. If $H$ is cocommutative and has finitely many grouplikes, this allows to see $H_{par}$ as the weak Hopf algebra coming from a Hopf category.
item.dc:creator: Tiago Luiz Ferrazza, William Hautekiet, Arthur Alves Neto

item.title: Restriction of $p$-modular representations of $U(2, 1)$ to a Borel subgroup
item.description: arXiv:1902.02018v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Let $G$ be the unramified unitary group $U(2, 1)(E/F)$ defined over a non-archimedean local field $F$ of odd residue characteristic $p$, and $B$ be the standard Borel subgroup of $G$. In this note, we study the problem of the restriction of irreducible smooth $\overline{\mathbf{F}}_p$-representations of $G$ to $B$, and we obtain various results which are analogous to that of Pa$\check{\text{s}}$k$\bar{\text{u}}$nas on $GL_2 (F)$ (\cite{Pas07}).
item.dc:creator: Peng Xu

item.title: Geometrizations of quantum groups and dual semicanonical bases
item.description: arXiv:2404.00663v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper, we give a geometrization of semicanonical bases of quantum groups via Grothendieck groups of the derived categories of Lusztig's nilpotent varieties. Meanwhile, we describe the dual semicanonical bases in terms of Serre polynomials of Grassmannians of modules over preprojective algebras.
item.dc:creator: Yingjin Bi

item.title: The Grothendieck group of a triangulated category
item.description: arXiv:2404.15800v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We give a direct proof of the following known result: the Grothendieck group of a triangulated category with a silting subcategory is isomorphic to the split Grothendieck group of the silting subcategory.
item.dc:creator: Xiao-Wu Chen, Zhi-Wei Li, Xiaojin Zhang, Zhibing Zhao

item.title: Wall-crossing for zero-dimensional sheaves and Hilbert schemes of points on Calabi-Yau 4-folds
item.description: arXiv:2102.01056v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Gross-Joyce-Tanaka arXiv:2005.05637 proposed a wall-crossing conjecture for Calabi-Yau fourfolds. Assuming it, we prove the conjecture of Cao-Kool arXiv:1712.07347 for 0-dimensional sheaf-counting invariants on projective Calabi-Yau 4-folds. From it, we extract the full topological information contained in the virtual fundamental classes of Hilbert schemes of points which turns out to be equivalent to the data of all descendent integrals. As a consequence, we can express many generating series of invariants in terms of explicit universal power series. i) On $\mathbb{C}^4$, Nekrasov proposed invariants with a conjectured closed form arXiv:1712.08128. We show that an analog of his formula holds for compact Calabi-Yau 4-folds satisfying the wall-crossing conjecture. ii) We notice a relationship to corresponding generating series for Quot schemes on elliptic surfaces which are also governed by a wall-crossing formula. This leads to a Segre-Verlinde correspondence for Calabi-Yau fourfolds.
item.dc:creator: Arkadij Bojko

item.title: Proof of the Ginzburg-Kazhdan conjecture
item.description: arXiv:2302.11160v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We prove that the affine closure of the cotangent bundle of the basic affine space of a complex semisimple group has conical symplectic singularities, which confirms a conjecture of Ginzburg and Kazhdan. We also show that this variety is $\mathbb{Q}$-factorial and has terminal singularities.
item.dc:creator: Tom Gannon

item.title: Denseness of $g$-vector cones from weighted orbifolds
item.description: arXiv:2307.02282v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We study $g$-vector cones in a cluster algebra defined from a weighted orbifold of rank $n$ introduced by Felikson, Shapiro and Tumarkin. We determine the closure of the union of the $g$-vector cones. It is equal to $\mathbb{R}^n$ except for a weighted orbifold with empty boundary and exactly one puncture, in which case it is equal to the half space of a certain explicit hyperplane in $\mathbb{R}^n$.
item.dc:creator: Toshiya Yurikusa

item.title: Gaitsgory's central functor and the Arkhipov-Bezrukavnikov equivalence in mixed characteristic
item.description: arXiv:2311.04043v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We show that the nearby cycles functor for the $p$-adic Hecke stack at parahoric level is perverse t-exact, by developing a theory of Wakimoto filtrations at Iwahori level, and that it lifts to the $\mathbb{E}_1$-center. We apply these tools to construct the Arkhipov--Bezrukavnikov functor for $p$-adic affine flag varieties at Iwahori level, and prove that it is an equivalence for type $A$ groups.
item.dc:creator: Johannes Ansch\"utz, Jo\~ao Louren\c{c}o, Zhiyou Wu, Jize Yu
